articles.description: Spanish Football Federation president Luis Rubiales resigns, Antony delays return to Man Utd, plus news from international matches.
articles.title: Reaction after Spanish football chief Rubiales quits

articles.description: Novak Djokovic has equalled Margaret Court's all-time record of 24 Grand Slam singles titles - but how many more will he win?
articles.title: 'One of sport's biggest achievements' - and Djokovic eyes more

articles.description: Scotland did not "show a true reflection" of themselves after being dominated by South Africa in their Rugby World Cup opener, says Finn Russell.
articles.title: South Africa loss not true reflection of Scots - Russell

articles.description: Follow live text updates and BBC radio commentary from day two of round 14 of the 2023 County Championship.
articles.title: County Championship, day two - radio & text

articles.description: While they may not have won, both Charley Hull and Shane Lowry can reflect on successful weekends as they build towards the Solheim and Ryder Cups, writes Iain Carter.
articles.title: Hull and Lowry in mood to boost hope of European glory

articles.description: Watch all the best action from week one of the new NFL season as Tyreek Hill stars for the Dolphins, Christian McCaffrey runs in a spectacular touchdown for the 49ers and the Jaguars' Zay Jones completes an incredible catch.
articles.title: Jones' one-handed touchdown catch leads NFL best plays

articles.description: The Davis Cup Finals group stage begins this week with Great Britain one of 16 nations trying to make it through to the knockout stage.
articles.title: Can returning Murray help GB advance in Davis Cup?

articles.description: Not even the Wales and Fiji players could quite comprehend the stunning spectacle we witnessed in Stade de Bordeaux on a sweltering Sunday night.
articles.title: Night of drama unfolds in the battle of Bordeaux

articles.description: BBC Sport's chief football writer Phil McNulty reflects on memorable moments between England and Scotland since the fixture's biggest scoreline in 1961.
articles.title: Gazza, thrashings and Tartan joy - the 'Auld Enemy' meet again

articles.description: The Green Bay Packers win without Aaron Rodgers, the San Francisco 49ers send out a warning and the Philadelphia Eagles spoil Tom Brady's party.
articles.title: All Packers need is Love and Brady's return ruined
